item.description:
This event open to all kayak types and canoes

The first in the Trilogy of Wednesday evening paddles on the Merrimack River. Come join us for a padldle on another slow moving very scenic section of the Merrimack River from Rocks Village Bridge. The Rocks Village Bridge contains the oldest movable span among all the bridges presently under MassHighway purview. It is located adjacent to the Rocks Village National Register Historic District, on a site which has been utilized as a major Merrimack River crossing since at least as the early 18th century.

Click here for more information on Rocks Village Bridge

View Photo above for a view of launch site

To date, only 44 movable bridges have been identified in MassHighway database; 13 of these are swing bridges, and 9 of the 13 are rim-bearing swings. The Rocks Bridge, the oldest of them all, is still operated by hand.

Directions:
Rocks Village Bridge Put-In located at the intersection of River Rd & Bridge Street West Newbury MA
* From Route 95, take Exit 57 Route 113 Storey Ave. toward West Newbury.
* Go 1 mile. Continue to follow 113 and go 2.8 miles.
* Turn right onto Bridge Street. Follow Bridge street to the water and put in is on the left.

Life Vests aka PFDs must be worn at all times to paddle with this group.

Google Maps directions to put-in at Rocks Village Bridge
item.how_to_find_us: Park alongside roadway on Bridge Street
item.name: Merrimack River MA at Rocks Village Paddle
